messageBody:
Hi Todd,

I am running Junit through NetBeans 5.5.1

I am using junit-3.8.1

I organized my tests in several TestSuites. Every TestSuite inherites
from a more general class called BaseProba, likewise BaseProba extends
AbstractTransactionalDataSourceSpringContextTests

Then later there is general a class called MainTest (extends TestCase)
that actually runs the tests. For instance,

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite ret = new TestSuite();

ret.addTestSuite(myTest1.class);
ret.addTestSuite(myTest2.class);

return ret;
}

About the tests, tests interact with a DBMS through Hibernate.
Hibernate dialect is HSSQL (HyperSonic SQL, a DBMS which stores its
data straight in memory). In addition, we also use Spring to set some
beans which are used by the test classes.

Basically, this is my environment. If you need further information I
do not mind giving you more detail.

Thanks is advance

Diego

> > Hi all,
> >
> > I wrote a pile of tests for my current project. Tests are
> > running OK when I run each of them individually. Every time I
> > run a testSuite I got a summary report about what methods
> > failed and which passed. I think this is Junit's expected behaviour.
> >
> > The point is that when I try to run my testSuites alltogether
> > at a time, I got no summary (just a line telling me the most
> > general test, the one which launches the other testSuites,
> > passed). It seems that Junit stops quietly, so I am afraid it
> > may fail.
> >
> > On the other hand, I forced some of the tests to fail, then I
> > got some summary output but only for those methods which failed.
> >
> > I do know whether this is related to my code or is it an
> > issue from Junit. I would be glad if anybody familiar with
> > this could shed some light...
> >
> > Thanks in advance
